rules.natural: In cases where the project is sustainability certified, energy efficiency is achieved for the project.
Should emissions reduction be verified for the project, environmental risks are not high for the project.
Whenever energy efficiency is achieved for the project, emissions reduction is verified for the project.
Either the project is financially viable or the project is successful.
Either a commercial partnership is secured for the project or government subsidy is approved for the project.
Provided that government subsidy is approved for the project, it is not the case that the project is financially viable.
Either regulatory approval is granted for the project or public support is high for the project.
Should the prototype be successful for the project, the technology is proven for the project.
If engineering revisions are needed for the project, then design flaws are present in the project.
Given that the project uses a renewable energy source, the project is successful.
Whenever public support is high for the project, no green bond is issued for the project.

Provided that international standards are met by the project, then if it is not the case that regulatory approval being granted for the project implies carbon credits are available for the project, then compliance issues do not exist for the project.

If an export license is granted for the project, then whenever it is not the case that either trade restrictions apply to the project or international standards not being met by the project implies certification is not pending for the project, then import tariffs are imposed on the project.
Either an export license is granted for the project or a free trade agreement applies to the project.

If preferential market access is available for the project, then in cases where it is not the case that either trade restrictions apply to the project or international standards not being met by the project implies certification is not pending for the project, then import tariffs are imposed on the project.
Provided that carbon credits are available for the project, no green bond is issued for the project.
If the project is patent protected, then whenever a free trade agreement applies to the project, preferential market access is available for the project.
Whenever private investment is committed to the project, a research grant is not rejected for the project.
If venture capital funding is provided for the project, then no research grant is rejected for the project.
Either an angel investor participates in the project or a corporate partner invests in the project.
Should a corporate partner invest in the project, then venture capital funding is provided for the project.
If intellectual property is secured for the project, then whenever an angel investor participates in the project, private investment is committed to the project.
Given that the technology is patented for the project, intellectual property is secured for the project.
Either the technology is patented for the project or a trade secret is protected for the project.
Whenever a trade secret is protected for the project, intellectual property is secured for the project.
Provided that operating costs are reduced for the project, it is not the case that the project is financially viable.
Should maintenance expenses be low for the project, then the project is not financially viable.
If cost efficiency is achieved for the project, then either operating costs are reduced for the project or maintenance expenses are low for the project.
Given that lifecycle cost is optimized for the project, cost efficiency is achieved for the project.
Whenever total cost of ownership is low for the project, lifecycle cost is optimized for the project.
Either competing technology is superior to the project or, if the project is not successful, then the prototype is successful for the project.
Provided that market leadership is maintained for the project, competing technology is not superior to the project.
If an innovation award is won for the project, then market leadership is maintained for the project.
Either an innovation award is won for the project or industry recognition is achieved for the project.
Should industry recognition be achieved for the project, then market leadership is maintained for the project.

If technical feasibility is confirmed for the project, then whenever the investment committee approves the project, then if regulatory approval is granted for the project, carbon credits are available for the project.

If a supply chain is established for the project, then either manufacturing capacity is adequate for the project or, if it is not the case that scalability being demonstrated for the project implies that whenever field testing being complete for the project does not imply the prototype is successful for the project, then technical challenges do not remain for the project, then mass production is feasible for the project.
Either a supply chain is established for the project or a distribution network is built for the project.
If a distribution network is built for the project, then logistics infrastructure is ready for the project.

Should logistics infrastructure be ready for the project, then either manufacturing capacity is adequate for the project or, if it is not the case that scalability being demonstrated for the project implies that whenever field testing being complete for the project does not imply the prototype is successful for the project, then technical challenges do not remain for the project, then mass production is feasible for the project.

Given that market demand is proven for the project, then if the investment committee approves the project, then whenever regulatory approval is granted for the project, carbon credits are available for the project.
If due diligence is complete for the project, then either technical feasibility is confirmed for the project or market demand is proven for the project.
Either due diligence is complete for the project or risk assessment is favorable for the project.
Whenever risk assessment is favorable for the project, then either technical feasibility is confirmed for the project or market demand is proven for the project.
If it is not the case that climate impact being positive for the project implies the project is successful, then environmental risks are high for the project.
Should it not be the case that climate impact being positive for the project implies the project is successful, then the project is sustainability certified.
Whenever it is not the case that regulatory approval being granted for the project implies carbon credits are available for the project, then compliance issues exist for the project.
Provided that it is not the case that field testing being complete for the project implies the prototype is successful for the project, then technical challenges remain for the project.

Whenever it is not the case that the project using a direct air capture system implies that if it employs carbon capture technology, then if it does not use a renewable energy source, the project is fossil fuel dependent, then geological storage is required for the project.

Should it not be the case that the project using a direct air capture system implies that whenever it employs carbon capture technology, then if it does not use a renewable energy source, the project is fossil fuel dependent, then geological storage is not required for the project.

Provided that it is not the case that either trade restrictions apply to the project or international standards not being met by the project implies certification is not pending for the project, then import tariffs are not imposed on the project.

Whenever it is not the case that either development is funded for the project or, if a green bond is issued for the project, then green financing is secured for the project, then a research grant is rejected for the project.

Should it not be the case that scalability being demonstrated for the project implies that if it is not the case that field testing being complete for the project implies the prototype is successful for the project, then technical challenges do not remain for the project, then mass production is not feasible for the project.

Provided that it is not the case that whenever it is not the case that a commercial partnership being secured for the project implies a revenue stream is established for the project, then operational costs are high for the project, then profit margin is low for the project.

If it is not the case that should it not be the case that a commercial partnership being secured for the project implies a revenue stream is established for the project, then operational costs are high for the project, then profit margin is not low for the project.

Should it not be the case that provided that it is not the case that field testing being complete for the project implies the prototype is successful for the project, then technical challenges do not remain for the project, then engineering revisions are needed for the project.

If it is not the case that whenever it is not the case that field testing being complete for the project implies the prototype is successful for the project, then technical challenges do not remain for the project, then design flaws are not present in the project.
Should international standards not be met by the project, then certification is pending for the project.
If the project is not successful, then a green bond is issued for the project.
If the project is not successful, then field testing is complete for the project.

(A1 → A41).natural: If a green bond is issued for the project, then green financing is secured for the project.

(A10 → G).natural: Provided that the climate impact is positive for the project, the project is successful.

(A12 → A13).natural: Whenever the project is sustainability certified, emissions reduction is verified for the project.

(A12 → A14).natural: In cases where the project is sustainability certified, energy efficiency is achieved for the project.

(A12 → ¬A11).natural: Given that the project is sustainability certified, it is not the case that environmental risks are high for the project.

(A13 → ¬A11).natural: Should emissions reduction be verified for the project, environmental risks are not high for the project.

(A14 → A13).natural: Whenever energy efficiency is achieved for the project, emissions reduction is verified for the project.

(A15 ∨ G).natural: Either the project is financially viable or the project is successful.

(A16 ∨ ¬A15).natural: Either a revenue stream is established for the project or it is not the case that the project is financially viable.
